user.name: Felicia
user.about:
Actress, New Media Geek, Gamer, Reader. Voracious consumer of Fantasy and Sci-Fi, especially with a romance twist. Has a book club on Goodreads called Vaginal Fantasy to celebrate the smuttier side of genre literature. Join in if you dare!

Creator of The Guild and producer of the web series network Geek and Sundry.
user.interests: Fantasy, Computer Games, Web Video, Science Fiction TV
user.favorite_books: Urban Fantasy, Mystery (with a touch of romance), Epic Fantasy, Space Operas

update.action_text: wants to read The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth, #1)

update.action_text: Felicia commented on the topic Nov Book Suggestion in Vaginal Fantasy Book Club
update.body:
Feel free to pick your own book to discuss, but this month"s main that seems fun is:
Chloe Neil"s "The Veil". It"s a newer book, so feel free to pick another if you aren"t into it, just start a thread in this folder!
http://www.amazon.com/Veil-Devils-Isl...


I tried to get a themed one, but the Thanksgiving romance list is... well, see for yourself:
https://www.goodreads.com/list/show/8...

update.action_text: Felicia commented on the topic UPDATE FOR NOV/DEC: Holiday Hiatus! in Vaginal Fantasy Book Club
update.body:
Hey all! Given the crazy holiday schedules, the birth of Kiala"s baby, and everyone"s business, we have decided to take November and December off from doing the videos!
This doesn"t mean the group goes dead though! Feel free to post any discussions here on books you"re reading over the holidays, recommendations etc. This can be a time to share new discoveries!

ALSO if you have any January requests for main books, leave them IN THIS THREAD! Always excited to discover new genres or voices, so post your suggests here!

And feel free to create topics in this forum subject about anything under the sun! I"ll post a suggested main for November and Dec. but feel free to pick your own too!

Thanks all, happy holidays, and see ya in the new year!
oxxo
VagFan Ladies

author.name: Grace Draven
author.about: I"m an author and Louisiana native living in Texas with my husband, three smalls and a big doofus dog. I have lived in Spain, hiked the Teton Mountains, honeymooned in Scotland, ridden in competition rodeo and am the great great granddaughter of a Nicaraguan president. I also hate doing laundry and refuse to iron anything.\r \r I"ve loved storytelling since forever. I published my first short story with Amber Quill Press and have since written several other tales. A love of the bad boy in fiction always inspires me.

update.action_text: gave 5 stars to Ink and Bone (The Great Library, #1) by Rachel Caine
update.body: I am on book tour currently, and now appreciate every author who ever lived because this stuff is CRAY! It"s like doing a convention for 3 weeks straight, but you"re flying to different cities every day and since i"m a REALLY picky sleeper, I"m starting to feel like someone"s trying to murder me...more...

update.action_text: is currently reading Ink and Bone (The Great Library, #1)

review.review:
I am on book tour currently, and now appreciate every author who ever lived because this stuff is CRAY! It"s like doing a convention for 3 weeks straight, but you"re flying to different cities every day and since i"m a REALLY picky sleeper, I"m starting to feel like someone"s trying to murder me if the bed has a low thread count. Anyway, I loaded my Kindle up with reads in anticipation of traveling a lot, and this book was #1 on my list to get to first. And I loved it!
I"m a big fan of Rachel Caine from her romance novels (and I know her in real life because I fanned out when I met her over her books several years ago, haha). She wrote a few series we"ve read in my Vaginal Fantasy book club, so imagine my surprise when I read this, and it"s not a girlie romance at all, it"s a YA novel with a boy protagonist. And it"s SO GOOD!
This series is a fantasy love letter to books. When I was reading it, all I could think about was how much I loved going into a library as a kid and flipping through the books and finding new worlds. How it was forbidden to draw in a book and how terrible it was to mess one up in the slightest. Books were special. This series is set in an alt world where printing presses don"t exist, the Library in Alexandria never was burnt, and knowledge is controlled by an all-powerful Library (capital letter). Our hero is a member of a family who smuggles actual books, so you"re dropped immediately into a fantasy world that"s rich with conflict. Anyway, I don"t want to give more away, but there are amazing themes about freedom and the average person"s right to knowledge, as well as the permeating feeling of REVERENCE towards books. I felt very guilty that I was reading it on a kindle, lol, and wanted to run out and buy a real live book immediately after reading.
Anyway, if you love books, this is a great read. It"s YA in tone but not too kiddie, there"s some dramatic stuff that happens, but it sets up for some great twists in the next book, which I"ll be sure to pick up. A quick fun read.

author.name: Rachel Caine
author.about: Rachel Caine is a pen name of Roxanne Longstreet Conrad.\r \r She has also published as:\r Roxanne Longstreet\r Roxanne Conrad\r Julie Fortune\r Ian Hammell\r \r Her Facebook page:\r https://www.facebook.com/rachelcainefanpage?sk=info
